chemistry.question: Copper and tin mix to create which alloy?
What chemical element has the symbol Pb?
Substances initially involved in a chemical reaction are known as what?
What in particular is it that gives fireworks their myriad of colors?
What is the opposite of the word 'alkali'?
CH4 is the chemical symbol for which gas?
Which element has the atomic number 1?
The oil used in the froth floatation process is?
Which element has a relative atomic mass of 1?
Which fuel releases the most carbon dioxide when used?
What is the second most abundant element in the Universe?
Calcium is displayed on the Periodic Tables as?
How many forms of radioactivity are there?
Which is the only metal that is in liquid form at room temperature?
What does salt do in water?
What industrial chemical is made by the Haber-Bosch process?
Which element is present in all organic compounds?
Which chemical element is the main source of nuclear energy?
What is produced in the Haber-Bosch process?
Approximately how many molecules thick is a piece of paper?
H2O contains how many elements?
When was the element bohrium discovered?
What is the opposite of alkaline?
Whereabouts does the group of elements known as the Actinides appear in the Periodic Table?
Approximately how many different organic chemical compounds are currently known?
Water is made up of hydrogen and what else?
The most abundant rare gas in the atmosphere is?
Which gas can be used to fill balloons, and to effect a comedy voice if inhaled ...?
Which is the only substance on Earth which is naturally present in solid, liquid and gaseous form?
The law which states that the amount of gas dissolved in a liquid is proportional to its partial pressure is known as which law?
How many different elements are there in CH3COOH?
What is the chemical symbol for Americium?
Which element was discovered in 1250?
Which element has the chemical symbol Ti?
The main active constituent of tea and coffee is?
A 'buckyball' is an allotrope of which element ?
Chlorine, bromine and iodine are members of which group of chemical elements?
How many chemical elements are there in the group known as the lanthanides?
What is a benefit of a limestone quarry?
What is the chemical symbol for Bromine?
What is the process called when some molecules of water turn into gas?
The property of lasting a long time before wearing out is know as what?
The element symbol for potassium is?
What is the pH value of apple juice?
When water is cooled what happens?
Bronze is a mix of how many metals?
What name is given to atoms of the same element that have different atomic weights?
Which state of matter is most dense?
Incomplete combustion can produce black particles of what?
Photosynthesis is a chemical process through which plants produce?
At what number in the Periodic Table would you find Einsteinium?
What type of substances do we get from substances called 'ores'?
Which chemical element has the symbol 'K'?
N is the symbol of which chemical element?
The solid state of water is known as what?
The major constituent of air is which gas?
Which crystalline hydrocarbon is used to make mothballs?
If iodine is dropped on food that contains starch, what color does it turn? Dark ____
When was the element ununbium discovered?
The mineral containing both magnesium and calcium is?
How many chemical elements begin with the letter Z?
When solids reach their melting points they become what?
What is sodium chloride more commonly known as?
Magma, spewed out in volcanic eruptions during the Earth's early life and solidified into hard rocks called?
Which element has the atomic number 21?
What is the main constituent of limestone(formula)?
Which acid has the formula HNO3?
Most plastics are what?
How many neutrons is there in a Hydrogen (H), atom?
In comparison with steel, what is pure iron like?
What state is fluorine in at room temperature?

physics.question: A circuit with more than one path is known as a what circuit?
A magnifying glass is what type of lens?
A thermometer is a device used to measure what?
About how many minutes does it take sunlight to reach Earth?
Albert Einstein won which award for physics in 1921?
Albert who is best known for his theory of relativity?
An ion has a what?
Uranium is used to create which kind of energy?
Electric current is a flow of what?
Electric current is measured using what device?
Electric current is typically measured in what units?
Electric power is typically measured in what units?
Electric resistance is measured in what?
How much does a person weigh on the Moon compared to Earth?
How does static electricity build up when walking on a carpet?
What is the term for a supposed alien aircraft seen in the sky?
What is the recognized theory of how the world came into being?
What measures the weight of a pumpkin?
What monitors the radiation dose a nuclear worker receives?
What tool can be used to measure fluid volume?
Which instrument would you use to measure electric potential?
What kind of lens does a magnifying glass have?
In blue light, what color will a red book appear?
Signals can pick up random additions on their way to a receiver. What is this called?
Sound travels fastest through what?
The distance from the crest of one wave to the next crest is called the what?
What are the best absorbers of thermal radiation?
What color is the live wire in a mains plug?
What color is the neutral wire in a plug?
Rocket science has a 'proper' name too - what is it?
Space based satellite navigation system is called what?
The technology used to locate and detect objects is called?
What are spaceships launched from?
What is the function of the earth wire in a plug?
How many different states are there in a digital signal?
Lasers work by focusing what waves?
Microwaves are used for satellite communications because they are not ____ by atmosphere?
Mobile phones use what sort of radiation to communicate with their base stations?
The state of the art technology used to train pilots is a flight....?
What kind of resistance do conductors have?
What type of radiation is used when cell phones communicate with the base stations?
What units are used to measure electric current?
What units would you use to measure the mass of something?
Who allegedly said: There is no great genius without a mixture of madness?
Why airplanes fly is explained in Bernoulli's?
Isaac Newton is best known for discovering what?
Lighting bending as it enters another entity is called what?
Which word completes the sentence :A reflection is to light as an ... is to sound'?
What is optics the study of?
On a circuit diagram, which item can be represented by a circle with a diagonal cross in it?
If a metal expands when it gets hot what does it do when it cools?
One who studies physics is known as a what?
Roughly what shape are most planets?
The most recognized model of how the universe began is known as what?
Jupiter and Saturn have clouds made of what?
Planets that are giant balls of gas with hot liquid centers are called what?
Open circuits always have what?
The distance light travels in a year is known as a what?
Our galaxy is what?
The sun is the earth's major source of what?
The surface of the sun is very what?
Physics is known as the what science?
Physics is one of the oldest academic what?
The International Space Station was first launched in which year?
Astronauts can only eat food that is what?
What cannot escape from black holes?
Physics studies motion through time and what?
The movement of particles from an area of high concentration to low is what?
NASA is based in which country?
How many planets are there in the Solar System?
How many suns does Earth have?
In our solar system which would be the hottest of these planets to live on?
Which is likely to be the first planet humans will set foot on?
Which kind of flight involves breaking the sound barrier?
Which planet has the highest mountain and deepest valley in the solar system?
Which planet is the only planet not named after a Greek or Roman god?
Which planets are Jupiter's closest neighbors in the solar system?
Why does light from distant galaxies red-shifted?
In physics, a Newton is a measurement of what?
What controls our tides?
What do planets do around the sun?
What do stars emit?
What do we call that theory which claims that a small mass blew up and grew, creating the universe?
What do we use to look at the stars?
What do you need to see Neptune from Earth?
The Pa, or Pascal, is a unit of what?
What is Earth?
What does 'S' stand for in NASA?
The scientist who gave us the 3 laws of Motion?
What is something that orbits the Earth known as?
What is the first name of the scientist who gave us the Hubble Space Telescope?
What is the moon commonly said to be made out of?
What is the only natural satellite to orbit the Earth?
What is the smallest planet in the Solar System?
What is the study of celestial objects called?
What is the Sun?
What kind of planet is Saturn?
What planet are we on?
What planet in the solar system is farthest from the Sun?
What planet is famous for its big red spot?
What planet is famous for the beautiful rings that surround it?
What was the name of the space program aiming to get men on the moon?
Which god and planet have the alternative name of 'Jove'?
Which statement about transformers is correct?
Batteries convert chemical energy into which kind of energy?
Charge in motion is called what?
Closed circuits have no what?
Heat from the fuel is used to boil water in which kind of power station?
How do atomic bombs work?
Materials that allow electricity to flow through them easily are called what?
What is the voltage of the mains supply in the USA?
Where does most electricity in the United States come from?
Why are plugs made of plastic?
How many centimeters are there in a meter?
How many Watts are in a Kilowatt?
The imperial system and the metric system are two systems for what?
The intensity of illumination is referred to as which SI unit?
Velocity is another name for what?
What does N in NEO stand for?
What does R stand for in CMBR?
What does the 'R' stand for in RADAR?
What is a light year a unit of?
What is a Geiger counter used to measure?
What are the moving charges in metal conductors?
Metal bonding with metal is known as what kind of bond?
What charge do electrons have?
What charge do neutrons have?
What do we use to turn an electric light on or off?
Which units are used to measure electrical power?
How does nuclear power create energy?
Spinning a magnet in a coil of wire generates what?
Materials that don't allow electricity to flow through them easily are called what?
What is the disadvantage of hydroelectric power produced by using a dam?
What is the basic unit of electromotive force?
What is the basic unit of resistance?
What is the charge on a proton?
Two particles with the same charge will what?
What is the name for the flow of electrons in an electric circuit?
What is the name given to something that uses electricity to make it magnetic?
What is the wire inside of a light bulb called?
Which instrument would you use to measure resistance?

computer.question: A coder who can develop both client-side and server-side software is known as a full-___ developer. What word that can also mean a serving of pancakes goes in the blank?

The 'Big Four' in the tech industry are Google (Alphabet), Apple, Meta (Facebook), and Amazon. Which corporation known for computers, software, and Bill Gates, is sometimes added to form the 'Big Five' (or GAMAF)?
Welsh software engineer Josh Wardle was paid in the 'low seven figures' by the New York Times in January 2022 for what wildly popular daily game?
Adobe makes what popular multi-purpose graphic design software that allows users to edit camera images? Its name sounds like a type of store where you can buy these images.
What is the programming language developed by James Gosling at Sun Microsystems and named after the type of coffee from Indonesia?
In 1999 Shigetaka Kurita invented what keyboard additions for cell phones that would eventually replace emoticons and even get their own movie?

An open-source, distributed multi-model NoSQL document-oriented database software package for interactive applications, formerly known as Membase, is ______base. Fill in the one word 'C' blank, also a term for a long upholstered piece of furniture that people sit on.
Which utensil term describes when software gets updated or a protocol is changed so that the blockchain splits and 'forges its own path,' so to speak? (Hint: They can be 'hard' or 'soft')
What popular operating system, launched in 1991, also has its own mascot, Tux the penguin?
What free program in the Google Docs Editors suite corresponds to Excel in Microsoft's Office suite of software?

The mobile app development company Niantic struck gold in 2016 with what smash-hit smartphone game that captured tens of millions of players within days of its release? The game became a global phenomenon with players largely playing outdoors.
In the last year more than 250 billion PDFs were opened using products from what highly successful creative software company?
On the market for four decades, AutoCAD is a specific brand of CAD software. CAD stands for 'Computer-Aided' WHAT?
In the programming world, the acronym SaaS stands for 'software as a' WHAT?

If you work in supply chain management you're probably familiar with the top software company in the business. What's the name of the company that started in Germany in 1972 that's especially well-known for its enterprise resource planning (ERP) software and more recently its cloud-based products?
What term is used for a testing environment in a computer system in which new or untested software or coding can be run securely? In a different context, this term refers to a children's play area.
If you work in supply chain management, you likely use enterprise ______ planning (ERP) software at each stage of the process—from planning, producing, and moving goods to keeping track of finances.

What is the name of the Egypt-based software company that primarily offers a bug reporting tool with a'Shake to Send'feature? The company integrates with many other tools thought its SDK and raised $5 million in a Series A led by Accel in 2020.
What'R'ransomware, known for targeting large public-entity Microsoft systems, may install itself by way of the Trickbot Trojan malware?
HANA is the name of the relational database management system developed by what German corporation, which is, by revenue, the largest non-American software company in the world?
SQS is an AWS that makes it easy to keep messages between software and apps organized without having to worry about losing them. SQS stands for Simple ______ Service.
What professional social networking site announced a theft of 6.5 million usernames and passwords in 2012, and an even bigger hack of 117 million passwords in 2016?

Eric Yuan is a former Cisco engineer and executive that left the telecom giant to found what speedy meeting company in 2011? The company released its first version of their eponymous software two years later and had a 'breakout year' in 2020.
The icon of a white video camera in a green square represents what app that's pre-installed on Apple's iPhone?

When you compare the Microsoft Office Suite to Apple's iWork software, Word is to Pages, PowerPoint is to Keynote, and Excel is to what program named after the part of a keyboard traditionally found below the 'F' keys?
What 'M' computer security company, founded by namesake John in 1987 before being acquired by Intel in 2011, is well known for its anti-virus software that is available to individual consumers?
A Rochester, New York developed what open-source operating system written in way more than three lines of code and named for what short poetry form?
After Microsoft and IBM, which Texas-based computer tech corp (known for its databases) is the third-largest in the world?

He had intended to call it Freax, but his friend changed the name without consulting him. Finnish-American software engineer Linus Torvalds is best known as the creator of what piece of open source software?
Which French financial software startup with unicorn status bills itself (no pun intended) as 'the future of payroll and HR?'
Developed by Dan Dennedy, what free and open-source video-editing program was first released in 2011 and can be used across platforms including FreeBSD, Linux, macOS, and Windows?
Steve Jobs is famously one of the two men who co-founded Apple in 1976. The other co-founder was also named Steve. What was this other man's surname?
What term that can describe part of a house also means a way to access a computer system or encrypted data that bypasses the system's usual security mechanisms?
'Ordinateur' is the word for 'computer', and 'logiciel' is the word for 'software', in what Romance language?

Larry Ellison co-founded a company in 1977 with the rather boring name of Software Development Laboratories (SDL). In 1983, the company introduced what word into its official name? This new word is the name of the company today and also means a person considered to provide wise counsel or prophetic predictions.

Android is well-known for codenaming its different versions for sweet treats such as Jelly Bean and Cupcake. What cookie brand was the codename for the 2017 release of the popular mobile phone software?
What 'U' software is is a Linux distribution based on Debian? It is offered in Desktop, Server, and Core For Internet.
Fill in the name of the app missing from the title of this January 2022 Wall Street Journal article title: 'Why Apple's ___ Is Winning: Teens Dread the Green Text Bubble.'

A Massachusetts company that offers software and services based on PostgreSQL, whose motto is 'Power To Postrgres', and whose logo is a red circle, is ______DB. Fill in the one word blank, also the name of the starship on the 1960s TV show 'Star Trek.'
Founded in 1983 in Mountain View, CA, what accounting software was imagined as Quicken for small business owners?
What 'K' IT infrastructure technology company, based out of Armonk, New York, started as a spinoff of IBM? Its logo is its own name, spelled out in lowercase orange letters.

An American company, founded by Olivier Pomel in 2010, that monitors cloud-scale applications through a SaaS-based data analytics platform, is DataD______. Fill in the one word blank, an animal seen in their purple logo playfully holding a chart.
What talking paper fastener, who served as a virtual assistant in Microsoft Office programs from 1997 until the mid-2000s, will be making a comeback as an emoji, according to the company?
What is the name of the Austin-based software business founded by brothers David and Donald Yonce considered to be in the middle of the December 2020 Federal government hack?

What 'O' open source office suite, discontinued in 2011, was started by Sun Microsystems, and acquired by Oracle shortly before its closure? Its name implied it was available to users across all platforms.
What 'A' antivirus software is a freeware solution available across multiple platforms, with an amoeba like orange 'A' as a logo? It is also a pirate word meaning 'Stop.'
A Real-Time ______ System or RTOS can handle a lot of events happening at once that need to be processed in a timely fashion—think the software that handles air traffic control.

Back in the late '90s when you couldn't quickly edit photos or make a gif on any device, you probably downloaded which free, open-source graphics editing software with an icon that's a dog with a paintbrush in its mouth? (Hint: Its an acronym for GNU Image Manipulation Program)
Internet mogul Richard Barton founded the online travel companyExpedia, the employment search engine and company review website Glassdoor, and what internet-based real estate company?

What is the name of a Unix shell and command language written as a free software replacement for the Bourne shell? It also completes the blank of the Mark-Paul Gosselaar lawyer comedy show 'Franklin and ______', and the World Championship Wrestling pay-per-view '______ At The Beach.'
Billing itself as 'The World's #1 Identity Platform', what cloud software company gets its four-letter name from a meteorological unit used to describe the amount of cloud cover at a given location?
In 1994, which computer company launched its first web browser, Navigator?

What innovative radio company developed the Music Genome Project to classify music by mirroring mathematical techniques for gene sequencing within human DNA? The company is named after the first human woman created by the gods in Greek mythology.
Providing software that focuses on customer service and market automation, what San Francisco-based company has a blue cloud logo with its name in the middle?
Which F-term refers to software that's built into hardware, like a BIOS?
What color do you get if you mix together the two colors that appear twice in the Google logo?
In the week between March 11 and March 18, 2020, what Microsoft app went from 32 million to 44 million daily active users, up to 115 million by October of the same year?

Software developers at Disney created Hyperion, a program to produce more realistic animated scenes by determining the correct angle and intensity of light and shadows, that is Disney's in-house version of what type of software?

In the early '90s, Symantec acquired a software program developed by a computer programmer named Peter Norton. It's since become one of the most commonly used and well-known of which kind of computer security software?
The free, open-source operating system GNU is a recursive, or self-referential, acronym that stands for 'GNU's Not' what other operating system?
Jack Dorsey is most known for co-founding Twitter, but he is also CEO of another tech company. What is the name of this other company most well-known for credit card readers?
What term is given to a software application that automatically downloads or displays marketing banners or pop-ups when a user is online?
What 'R' database software, an in-memory data structure store with a red stacked logo, was originally written by Salvatore Sanfilippo in 2009?
What is the seven-letter branded software standard created by Apple that enables a car radio or touchscreen to be a display and a controller for an iOS device?
In September 2022, what video game company acknowledged a massive leak of assets from an upcoming release of a game in its popular Grand Theft Auto franchise?

In 2017, Misys merged with D+H to form the third-largest financial services company in the world. Now providing its software and other products to more than 8,600 institutions globally, what's the company's name?
The Ports of Los Angeles and New Orleans have been implementing the PortXchange logistics software used by what Dutch seaport, the busiest in Europe?
What is the version number of Apple's latest iOS, notable for the ability to edit and delete recently sent iMessages even if the user doesn't own an iPhone 14?
A type of remote project management software shares what name for general yoga postures that help one relax after remote project management?
Kubernetes was not named kubernetes until it was open sourced by Google in 2014. Prior to that it was known by what four-letter name of an alien species in the 'Star Trek' franchise?

What is the tasty name of the series of small single-board computers developed by an eponymous foundation in the UK and often used for the promotion of teaching computer science concepts in schools and developing countries?
Common, HDFS, YARN, MapReduce, and Ozone are key modules in what popular open source big data framework managed by the Apache Software Foundation?
Mozilla is a free software community best known for its web browser Firefox. What is the name of Mozilla's email client product?
What is the name of the research and advisory firm that puts out 'magic quadrants', ranking different enterprises software products?

Although the company maintains and distributes many types of open source software, it is most well known for its enterprise Linux and virtualization products. What is this company headquartered in Raleigh and purchased by IBM in 2019? You might also see their name written when visiting a haberdasher.
Which AWS lets you plan and run all kinds of computing jobs at once (in a bunch, you might say) without having to manage it or download any third-party software?

Norton AntiVirus is an anti-malware and anti-virus software package that has been developed and distributed by what company since 1991? This parent company has a portmanteau'd name and was first publicly traded in 1989.
Just Dance, Assassin's Creed, and Tom Clancy's Rainbow Six are among the video game franchises developed by what French software company?

As documented in'The Zen of Python,'the core philosophy of the open source programming language Python includes pithy aphorisms such as'Beautiful is better than ugly'and'Simple is better than complex.'The final of these phrases is'Readability ______.'What word fills in the blank?

The non-profit Mozilla is likely best-known for its Firefox browser but also built what aviary email and RSS client that was first launched in 2004 and is currently supported by a wholly-owned subsidiary?

In 2005, Linus Torvalds created software for tracking changes on files in order to improve development of the Linux kernel. Since 2005, the open-source software has had Junio Hamano as the core maintainer. What is the three-letter name of this uber-popular software among developers?
Which type of computer database supports storage of all data types, with specific attributes and methods for each individual item of data?
What's the name of the macOS released on October 24, 2022, that brought features like Stage Manager and updates to Messages to Macs? (Hint: It's a place in California, too)

What smartphone app and fintech company was founded by father and son duo Walter Wemple Cruttenden III and Jeffrey James Cruttenden to promote incremental and passive investing in 2014? The company's app features a light green color scheme and shares its name with a seed enclosed in a tough, leathery shell. The portfolio options the company offers were designed in part by Nobel laureate Harry Markowitz.

With an initial release in 2003, what is the free open-source content management system written in PHP and paired with a MySQL (or MariaDB) database that features numerous plugins and templates known as 'Themes' and is currently used by 39% of the 10 million most-popular websites in the world?
What's the name of the plain-text version of a computer program that humans can read and (maybe) understand?

Mostly famous for its 'Notebook' product, what is the name of the open source community and project taking its name as a combination (in some order) of three core programming languages: R, Julia, and Python?
According to Apple, what avatar-creation software was the most downloaded app from the App Store in 2017?
One of the most popular software programs for music notation and composition has what'S'name, after the man who many consider to be Finland's national composer?

The first principle in the influential 'Manifesto for Agile Software Development' reads as follows: 'Our highest priority is to satisfy the ______ through early and continuous delivery of valuable software.' What word is missing?
Software development methods typically are considered to range from adaptive to ______, and agile typically lies on the adaptive side of the spectrum. What word fills in the blank?
Fill in the missing word from one of the 12 principles from 'The Manifesto for Agile Software Development': ______—the art of maximizing the amount of work not done—is essential.
What platform-as-service analytics company, a personalization of the Apache Pinot software, sounds like a celestial body turned into a woody perennial plant?
What 'x'tremely useful software owned by Cox Automotive allows for car dealers to have direct insight into the cars they sell, allowing for prompt service appointments among other features?

What open source alternative to Facebook, which allows users to generate money or cryptocurrency for using the platform, was founded in 2011 in Glastonbury, CT? A popular CBS police procedural deals with the Criminal versions of this company's one-word name.

What three-lettered invention of Heineken is a green robotic cooler that can autonomously deliver beer to customers? Its name is a common shorthand for robots, and also for a software application that runs automated online tasks.

What is the five-letter name of the London-based company that provides software for virtual events and raised *three* rounds of venture capital in 2020 totaling more than $170 million? The company grew from 5,000 to over 3 million users during the year.

What website design and implementation tool was founded by Bryant Chou, Sergie Magdalin, and Vlad Magdalin in 2012 and did not raise a series A fundraising round until 2019? However, when they raised that round of funding, it was a cash injection of more than $70 million.

What 'Z' software company, opened in 2005 in Sunnyvale, California and acquired by BETSOL in 2018, contributes to many open source projects? Its name is reminiscent of the first name of the young star of the 'Mamma Mia' films, with a Z replacing the first letter.
What'P'word can describe both a square sewn over a hole in clothing, or a set of changes to update, fix, or improve a software program?

Created in 2009 and based in Austin, Texas, what 'A' software company helps optimize workplace productivity in the remote space by streamlining workflow and limiting distractions, keeping employees energetic?
If you were trying to download music circa 2000, which free P2P software program with a fruity name did you probably rely on?
Despite its name, which Swedish startup founded in 2013 makes a big promise to be 'the first PDF software you'll actually like?'
Wazuh is a free, open source software for threat detection and integrity monitoring. Its logo resembles a coyote, and is made out of what color?
Which free desktop app by Sinew Software Systems securely stores passwords and other sensitive user data locally instead of on servers?
Hiro Protagonist is a hacker fighting the insidious influence of a virus that affects both computers and human beings in what 1992 sci-fi novel by Neal Stephenson?

Headquartered in LA, which global fintech company with a name that combines a color and a geometric term provides cloud-based financial management software to huge corporations like Costco, Netflix, and Google?
Which Adobe web design software sounds like something you'd use to code a page in your sleep, or a 1975 song by Gary Wright?

In 2008, Texas Instruments introduced a single-board computer designed for hobbyists and as an educational tool for the development of open source software. The board is known as a ______ Board, with what canine word filling in the blank? (If you 'snoop' on their website, you'll see many different models are currently available.)
A Content ______ System (CMS) is a 'backend' software application that makes it easy for even non-designers to create and modify a website's content.
It sounds like the software is headed to the gallows, but which term actually means that a piece of code is telling a computer what to do (like giving it instructions)?
In 1979, Apple released its first spreadsheet computer program for the Apple II. What was the software called?

The name makes it sound like it's cool and up on the times, but which popular Canadian accounting software for businesses has actually been around since 2003? (Hint: One of the founders, Mike McDermont, said he came up with the concept after he actually saved over an invoice he was filling out)
Before becoming CEO of AWS, which data visualization software company did Adam Selipsky help navigate its acquisition by Salesforce in 2019?
Which 'edutainment' software publisher produced suites of games for PC and Mac in the '90s like 'Thinkin' Things,' 'Millie's Math House,' and 'Imagination Express?'
The Atanasoff-Berry Computer, the world's first electronic digital computer, was built during the 1930s in what U.S. state nicknamed the 'Hawkeye State'?
What is the'sunny'parent company of InvestorInfo, PitchBook, and ByAllAccounts?

What 'P' software and database company was founded in 2014 by Navin Chaddha, and is owned by Pure Storage? Its name is a compound word of a parking place for boats and and a unit of physical effort with an 'x' at the end.

In 1997, which Microsoft media player with custom visualizations, plug-ins, and cool skins hit the scene just in time to take advantage of the mp3 trend and soon became one of the most downloaded Windows applications ever?
LiMux was a project for migrating what huge Bavarian city from Windows to Linux?

What is the five-letter name for the general-purpose programming language first released in 2004 that was designed to be concise and aimed to address criticisms of Java? This language was designed by Martin Odersky and is the language used as the basis for Apache Spark.

Which type of 'bomb' is a bit of code put into software that is set up to trigger a malicious function if certain conditions are met? For example, some computer worms were infamously designed to attack on certain dates, like Friday the 13th.

You know those annoying'prove you're not a robot'tests that you have to take on websites sometimes? They're known as CAPTCHAs. And CAPTCHA is actually an acronym standing for'Completely Automated Public ______ test to tell Computers and Humans Apart.'What surname fills in the blank?
What company providing hosting for software development and distributed version control familiar to computer programmers is known for its iconic Octocat (part cat, part octopus) logo?
Led by President Alexander Lukashenko, what Eastern European nation passed a January 2023 law allowing piracy of software whose copyright holders are from'unfriendly nations?
Unicode, the standard for character encoding used to represent multilingual text as binary, is the successor of what US encoding standard?
Represented by a white camera in a blue teardrop icon, what is the name of Google's video chat mobile app?
Playing on the acronym CHEF, the Sakai Learning Management System was named for Hiroyuki Sakai, a star of what Japanese competition show set in Kitchen Stadium?
What 'A' software is open source provisioning, configuration management , and application-deployment tool? It was originally authored by Michael DeHaan and given a stable release in July 2021.
What 'n' is an informal term for software which is free for a trial period and thereafter frequently reminds the user to pay for it?

What is the Spain-headquartered software company, with annual revenue of more than $5.5 billion, that creates technology for travel searches, accommodation and transportation bookings, and more? The company shares its name with a famous composer's middle name.

Born in Bulgaria before attending Thomas Jefferson High School in Virginia and Stanford University in California, Vlad Tenev founded defunct trading company Celeris and then software company Chronos Research before eventually founding what still-functioning company in 2013?
Launched in 1992 by a team at the University of Kansas, which text-based web browser shares a name with a wild cat?

Which free, open-source media player with a traffic cone desktop icon did you probably have on your computer circa 2001? (Hint: The original name was VideoLANClient, but that name didn't stick as the software gained more capabilities)

VLC media player is free, open-source software that was first developed by students in France in the mid-90s. After being retooled by a global group of contributors, it officially launched in 2001. It was originally called VideoLAN ______ (VLC).

Written in Python and used as an open-source workflow management platform, what is the name of the'ventilated'Apache-managed project started at Airbnb in 2014 and designed under the'configuration as code'principle?
What 'C' cybersecurity, founded in Sunnyvale, CA in 2011, has a two word name that implies it can attack problems quickly across a variety of software? Its logo is a red hawk swooping in.
What term is used for a piece of software, a particular kind of user interface, that guides a user through a series of well-defined steps to complete a task?
An early spreadsheet application that competed with Microsoft Excel was named after a flower in the family Nelumbonaceae. What was the name of this software that was acquired by IBM?

What is the name of the programming language maintained by Microsoft that is considered a'strict syntactical superset'of Javascript? The language was designed for developing large applications and it transcompiles into JavaScript.

If you wanted to type up a 'flawless' document in the 1980s or early 1990s, which Windows word processor would you use? (Hint: It was owned by Novell before being acquired by Corel in 1996, and your file would be saved in '.wpd' format)

Martin A. Goetz, a pioneer in the development of the commercial software industry, received the first patent for software from The United States Patent and Trademark Office in which 20th century decade?

In 2000, a software engineer named Steve Gibson was the first person to describe what kind of software that steals personal information? (He defined it as any software that 'employs a user's Internet connection in the background [the so-called'backchannel'] without their knowledge or explicit permission' but the definition has expanded as technology has evolved)
Which type of software includes operating systems and utility programs, and is essentially the foundation you need to lay to be able to run other software on your machine—for example, applications?
What competing real estate website with a seltzer-sounding name did Zillow buy in 2015 for $2.5bn in stock?
Founded in 2015, what company, which is named after something you'd find in an apiary, bills its main software product as'the #1 productivity platform for fast-moving teams?
What was the spooky name of the first computer worm, created in 1971, that could be defeated by the first antivirus software (aptly named Reaper)?
Often associated with the software development strategy of Agile, what is the software engineering practice that unifies software operations with software development?

What is the three-letter initialism for the markup language that was first formally spec'd by the World Wide Web Consortium in 1998 and is designed with goals of simplicity, generality, and usability across the internet?
What programming language developed by Larry Wall is associated with a camel, the image that appeared on the language's first printed programming manual back in 1991?

What is the name of the 2012-founded San Francisco-based company that uses a spreadsheet-database hybrid in which features of a database are applied to a spreadsheet? Founded by Howie Liu, Andrew Ofstad, and Emmett Nicholas, the company widely shares its API for connecting other online services and has raised more than $300 million in funding (as of early 2021).
In 2009, the United States White House switched its website's CMS from a proprietary system to what popular'D'open-source CMS system that was initially released in 2001?

Which financial software from Envestnet offers client features like Play Zone and is considered the most popular among advisors (at least in terms of market share by user—it was at 36 percent in 2021)?
A demo of a game is an example of which type of software that lets users'try before they buy'(though only to a limited extent)?

What is the name of the online service and iOS app used for over-the-air installation and testing of mobile applications on Apple devices? This program is owned by Apple and is frequently used for downloading and testing alpha and beta versions of apps.
Applying to some apps written in C#, C++, Visual Basic, or Javascript, the abbreviation UWP stands for Universal WHAT Platform?
Which database analytics software company has been in the game since 1979 and has a name that will make you think of ~1 trillion bytes?
What'A'word important to software developers comes from a transliteration of the Arabic'al-Khwarizmi,'a native of the area now known as Uzbekistan?
Deeper Insights, Five AI, and Beyond Analysis are some of the top AI companies in what international city?
What technology company found a surprise hit on its hands in early 2018 with a viral app comparing selfies to famous pieces of art?
In 2013, a software bug caused what financial technology company to erroneously credit customer Chris Reynold's account with 92 quadrillion dollars, although the error was quickly corrected?

In the original Sid Meier's Civilization, which country ironically had a leader that would be set to maximum aggression upon adoption of democracy due to a software bug? (NOTE: we want the COUNTRY, not the leader)

The D_______ Free Software Guidelines, originally published in 1997 by Bruce Perens, are used to determine whether a software license is free or not. Fill in the blank, part of its namesake D_______ Project.
Before the name Java, the coding language was known by what arboreal name that also has poignancy in the Pokemon universe?
